title: riot has failed me
body:
this is one of the many reasons we need a tribunal system in australia

just recently i went into a game where i was flamed by a 4 person group on my team
the zyra repeatedly used words like "go kys" and "your fucking useless plz afk" my question is do you think anyone would sit there for 30-45 minutes without retaliating and the worst part was i got banned with no way to appeal.

halfway through the game i tried to apologise because i didnt want to fight anymore instead the zyra repeatedly went on to be negative by calling out anything i did wrong while also pinging me then even going as for as to ask what rank i am, i know retaliating isnt the way to go but do you think anyone would sit there and take the abuse?

the current report system feels useless in that it only works if you have a huge amount of reports to get something to happen

with the state of league of legends i dont think ill be coming back unless im playing with my friends because riot lets things like this become common place

replies.body:
I'm sure it's extremely difficult to have 4 people flaming you for 30 minutes, but that's the exact reason why the mute button exists. 

If you don't use the features designed to protect you, you can't really claim you had to _"sit there and take the abuse"_.

To start with, there is no tribunal on any server. Riot took it out several years ago to undergo some improvements, but it seems like that's been forgotten about. Best way to deal with troublesome players is still to report them, then the system will pick up the case(s), review the offending player(s) and dish out punishments as required. It's important to remember that the system wont work properly if it's not receiving reports.

As for appealing the punishment you received, all you need to do is contact support (found [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us)), though if you've retaliated to these players you probably wont get the result you're looking for. It's important to remember that retaliating does nothing to help the situation and that toxic behaviour is against the rules period, so it doesn't matter who started it. As Tele said, if it's that much of a problem you can utilise the mute feature to help get through the match and report in the post-game lobby, that way you're a lot less likely to do something that puts you in a bad position.

In regards to the report system feeling useless, that's understandable. However, it generally only requires a single report for a player to be picked up by the system, which is something a lot of players don't seem to know or consider. As long as you don't have a history of false reports, your reports should be doing enough to get troublesome players picked up by the system and undergo reviews.
